sense.name: a natural ability or talent
sense.examples: All of their children have artistic flair. He had enough musical flair to win the audition, even though he hadn't practiced the piece. Whoever decorated this room apparently has no flair for color!

sense.name: stylish physical appearance, panache
sense.examples: Mary taught her frumpy sister to dress with more flair, using scarves and jewelry. The dresses of this young designer have a flair all their own.

sense.name: an inclination or tendency
sense.commentary: FLAIR[+quality][+inclination][+personal] Note: refers to an interest or habitual behavior, rather than an ability or skill (Sense 1)
sense.examples: He has always had a flair for the grotesque and strange. (interest in) She tends to have a flair for exaggeration and histrionics.
